intro: Memecylon nervosum, commonly known as the veined memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent venation, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikes. Memecylon nervosum typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical ecosystems.
